intro: Sida rhombifolia var. corynocarpa, commonly known as the broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas due to its salt tolerance. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
